channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2023110079
item.description:
Report X-2023110079

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat package was being loaded at the station. There was a leak coming from the side of the package. It was immediately covered and kitty litter was used to contain the spillage. DescribePack: The cap from one of the bottles was loose and leaked from the top of the bottle. The leak soiled the remaining bottles in the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kitty litter was used to mitigate and contain the spillage of the package.

item.title: Report X-2023110064
item.description:
Report X-2023110064

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: EAST SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package unloaded off of trailer, package handler noticed smell of gas and gave to QA. QA brought package to well-ventilated area to start damage package report. DescribePack: Exterior and interior packaging not rated for Hazmat transportation. Package had to have been compromised in transit due to contents moving around inside leading to the failure of the caps on the canisters. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package brought to well-ventilated area with fan and then processed into hazmat drum.

item.title: Report X-2023101417
item.description:
Report X-2023101417

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found in unload with a small wet spot on the bottom side of the box. I put it in a hazmat bag, put it on a cart, and brought it over to the hazmat cage and put it on the fumes hud with the fan on. DescribePack: Two jugs in the box were wet, had loose caps and the seals were a little melted. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I put in a hazmat bag, put it on a cart and wheeled it over to our hazmat cage and put in on the fumes hud.

Report X-2023101395

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found on unload side wet. package was placed in tote and taken to hazmat cage for further inspection. upon inspection 1 of 2 bottles leaking from closure. DescribePack: failure in seal of closure DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in tote

item.title: Report X-2023101386
item.description:
Report X-2023101386

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023101386 SequenceEvent: package was found on unload side wet and leaking. package was placed in hazmat bag lined tote and taken to hazmat cage for further inspection. upon inspection package was clearly on its side for a period of time and one of the inner bottles had a loose cap causing leak. DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in hazmat bag lined tote and taken to hazmat cage for further inspection. 2. X-2023101388 SequenceEvent: package was found on unload side wet and leaking. package was immediately place in hazmat bag lined tote and taken wo hazmat cage for further inspection. package had clear signs that it was on its side and with other packages places on top of it. 1 of the 2 bottles had a loose cap causing leak. DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in hazmat bag lined tote and taken to hazmat cage for further inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023101335
item.description:
Report X-2023101335

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A box of corrosive liquid spilled over onto the floor. I used the powder neutralizer, broom and dustpan to sweep it up off the floor and into a hazmat bag. DescribePack: Two jugs were damaged. One with a broken cap and one with a melted seal/cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I put them in a hazmat bag, put it on a cart and brought it over to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023101313
item.description:
Report X-2023101313

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was improperly loaded onto a trailer. An IC that was between 4 and 5 feet tall was stood up and the hazmat was placed on top of it. The packages fell over while a package handler was unloading the trailer and the bottle broke upon impact. DescribePack: The seem of the bottle under the handle cracked open upon impact and released its contents DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: A QA administrator was immediately brought over to clear out the hazmat and clean up the spill.

item.title: Report X-2023101312
item.description:
Report X-2023101312

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Once the damage was noticed and identified the package was placed in a hazmat drum and brought to the hazmat cage by an administrator, they did the clean up as well. DescribePack: The hole is tiny, almost unnoticeable, appears to be caused by the dent it is on. Below the handle area of the bottle, not quite part of it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as they were aware of the damage employees began clean up and putting the hazmat in a drum

item.title: Report X-2023101169
item.description:
Report X-2023101169

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING IN THE TRAILER, BAY 6. RESPONDER WAS THE 1ST TO ARRIVE ON THE SCENE. HE SECURED THE AREA AND TRANSPORTED THE LEAKING PACKAGE TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSING.
